messages.subject: Breastpumps
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 10/25/02 12:47:35 AM Central Daylight Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 10/25/02 12:47:35 AM Central Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< And I am mad! She said if I ever have
another baby I need to get a pump from a reputable company, and apparently
they are expensive. But I am just mad, so mad. Do you all see how mad I am?
Why are formula companies making breast pumps? How fair is that? So many
women, discouraged at the 1/2 oz. of milk produced after 15 minutes of
pumping! So many women who just quit out of frustration! So, if you know a
woman who is about to have a baby, and she is going to breast-feed her baby,
help her get a really good pump! Not one of those cheepo Walmart ones! >>

Yep, that is true.
Insane isn't it? But they are more worried about selling a product than what
is best for babies.
LLL endorses that Lansinoh products. And I had good luck with all of their
stuff, which is available at Target and Wal-Mart I believe, but don't quote
me on that. I did buy the pads at Wal-Mart, can't remember if the breast pump
was there too.
I also had a Avent pump that worked fabulously.

Ren
